document_title: Stage 4 ovarian cancer: Symptoms, treatment and prognosis
subsection_content:
Stage IV ovarian cancer (final stage) is a phenomenon in which cancer cells originating from the ovaries or fallopian tubes or peritoneum have metastasized to distant organs outside the body's peritoneal cavity (such as liver, lungs, bones,...). At this time, treatment methods are meant to prolong life and reduce pain caused by disease symptoms for patients. (first)
Staging of ovarian cancer according to FIGO
Ovarian cancer is a group of malignant diseases with tumor cells originating from the ovaries, fallopian tubes or peritoneum growing into them, and is the leading cause of death from gynecological malignancies in women. . According to Globocan 2020 statistics, Vietnam recorded 1,404 new cases and 923 deaths due to the disease.
MSc. Luu Thao Ngoc - Doctor of Oncology Department of Tam Anh General Hospital, Hanoi, said that factors that increase the risk of ovarian cancer can include:
Genetic factors: family history of having relatives with ovarian cancer, breast cancer or colorectal cancer; people carrying mutations in the BRCA1/BRCA2 gene, people with family members with ovarian cancer, people with Lynch syndrome),...; Other factors such as: advanced age, overweight and obesity, treatment of menopausal symptoms with hormone replacement, late childbirth (after 35 years old) or no childbirth,...
Most patients are diagnosed in the advanced-metastatic stage, leading to a low 5-year survival prognosis. According to SEER 22 data (statistics from 2013-2019), the proportion of patients diagnosed in the distant metastasis stage is up to 55% and the 5-year survival rate is only 31.5%. Therefore, diagnosing the disease at an early stage and treating it promptly is very important.
